title: How to Make Moist Madeira Cake

steps.headline: Sieve the flour, salt and baking powder in a large bowl.
steps.description: This prevents the batter mixture from being lumpy.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and sugar together until fluffy.
steps.description: You can use your blender or hand mixer.

steps.headline: Beat eggs into the butter-sugar mixture.
Fold the mixture into the dry ingredients.
steps.description: You will now get a dough like consistency rather than batter. Don't panic. You are doing the right way. At this important point add enough milk to form the batter. Half a cup should work.

steps.headline: Add the vanilla essence.
steps.description: Mix well until you get a smooth mixture.

steps.headline: Place parchment or butter paper on the cake tin surface.
Pour your batter.
steps.description: Place in the oven for 40 minutes (Gas mark 4, 350 F, 180 C).

steps.headline: Remove the cake from the oven after the baking is done.

text: Sieve the flour, salt and baking powder in a large bowl. This prevents the batter mixture from being lumpy. Cream the butter and sugar together until fluffy. You can use your blender or hand mixer. Beat eggs into the butter-sugar mixture.  Fold the mixture into the dry ingredients. You will now get a dough like consistency rather than batter. Don't panic. You are doing the right way. At this important point add enough milk to form the batter. Half a cup should work. Add the vanilla essence. Mix well until you get a smooth mixture. Place parchment or butter paper on the cake tin surface.  Pour your batter. Place in the oven for 40 minutes (Gas mark 4, 350 F, 180 C). Remove the cake from the oven after the baking is done. Allow the cake to completely cool before peeling off the paper.
